translated: Among those five winds, the life-sustaining wind is the life of living beings, and the upward-moving wind is said to be strength.

original: rlung gnyis po de dag nyams shing gnod par gyur na ni tshe dang stobs kyang zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gnyis po de dag nyams shing gnod par gyur na ni tshe dang stobs kyang zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those two winds are impaired and damaged, life and strength are exhausted.

original: rlung rnam pa lnga po de dag gcig la gcig 'dres te ldan pa'am yang na mkhris pa la sogs pa nad gzhan du ma dang 'dres shing ldan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rlung rnam pa lnga po de dag gcig la gcig 'dres te ldan pa'am yang na mkhris pa la sogs pa nad gzhan du ma dang 'dres shing ldan pa yang rung ste /
translated: Those five kinds of winds, one mixed with the other, or also mixed with other diseases such as bile,

original: nad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa yin na ni lo gcig ma lon kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa yin na ni lo gcig ma lon kyang rung ste /
translated: if one knows the characteristics of the disease, even if it has not been a year,

original: de yang shin tu gso dka'o //
analyzed: de yang shin tu gso dka'o //
translated: it is very difficult to cure.

original: nad kyi mtshan nyid ma shes te lo gcig 'das pa phan chad ni gso dka' ba med do //
analyzed: nad kyi mtshan nyid ma shes te lo gcig 'das pa phan chad ni gso dka' ba med do //
translated: If one does not know the characteristics of the disease and it has been a year or more, there is no difficulty in curing it.

original: de ltar 'dres pa'i nad de dag gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na khong 'bras dang / nad gzhi mcher pa'i nad dang / snying nad dang / skran dang / me drod nyams pa la sogs pa bla brnan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dres pa'i nad de dag gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na khong 'bras dang / nad gzhi mcher pa'i nad dang / snying nad dang / skran dang / me drod nyams pa la sogs pa bla brnan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these combined diseases are not treated and are neglected, they can lead to complications such as ascites, spleen disorders, heart disease, tumors, and decreased digestive heat.

original: dreg nad kyi nad gzhi bshad pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dreg nad kyi nad gzhi bshad pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the sixteenth chapter, on the diagnosis of gout, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / sman pa'i bdag po seng ge sbas pa'i bu sman pa chen po pha khol zhes bya bas /
analyzed: // / sman pa'i bdag po seng ge sbas pa'i bu sman pa chen po pha khol zhes bya bas /
translated: The great physician Pha-khol, son of the physician lord Seng-ge-bhay

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po mdzad pa las nad gzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba bcu drug pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po mdzad pa las nad gzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba bcu drug pa rdzogs te /
translated: has composed The Quintessence of the Eight Branches. The sixteenth chapter, on the diagnosis of diseases, is completed.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i gnas gsum pa'o /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i gnas gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third section of The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po las gso ba'i dpyad nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po las gso ba'i dpyad nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba /
translated: The Twenty-Two Therapeutic Methods from The Quintessence Tantra of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing

original: rims nad gso ba'i le'u dang po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rims nad gso ba'i le'u dang po bshad par bya ste /
translated: The first chapter, on the treatment of contagious diseases, will now be explained.

original: de yang drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu la sogs pas bshad pa na re rims ni kha zas ma zhu ba'i gnas su zhugs nas rlung la sogs pa dang lhan cig gnas te /
analyzed: de yang drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu la sogs pas bshad pa na re rims ni kha zas ma zhu ba'i gnas su zhugs nas rlung la sogs pa dang lhan cig gnas te /
translated: When the great sages ƒÄtreya and others explain this, they say: ‚ÄúA fever enters the place where food is not digested and remains there together with wind and so on.

original: me drod nyams par byas nas nang gi rtsa'i lam bkag ste /
analyzed: me drod nyams par byas nas nang gi rtsa'i lam bkag ste /
translated: It weakens the digestive heat and blocks the internal channels.

original: rims nad skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rims nad skyed pa yin no //
translated: It produces a feverish illness.‚Äù

original: de la thog mar rims ma smin pa la ni smyung ba byas la /
analyzed: de la thog mar rims ma smin pa la ni smyung ba byas la /
translated: In the case of an unripened fever, first observe a fast.

original: nyams stobs bsrung ba la 'bad do //
analyzed: nyams stobs bsrung ba la 'bad do //
translated: Strive to protect your strength.

original: nyams stobs dang ldan na ni nad med pa @152b yin pas thog mar gso ba'i cho ga 'di dag bya'o //
analyzed: nyams stobs dang ldan na ni nad med pa @152b yin pas thog mar gso ba'i cho ga 'di dag bya'o //
translated: If you have strength, you will be healthy. Therefore, first perform these healing rites.

original: dang po smyung ba byas pas ni nyes pa rnams zad par byed de /
analyzed: dang po smyung ba byas pas ni nyes pa rnams zad par byed de /
translated: First, by observing a fast, you will eliminate faults.

original: me drod skyed cing lus yang la nad med pa dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / zas yi gar 'ong zhing kha zas 'ju la nyams stobs dang gzi mdangs rnams skye bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: me drod skyed cing lus yang la nad med pa dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / zas yi gar 'ong zhing kha zas 'ju la nyams stobs dang gzi mdangs rnams skye bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: You will generate digestive heat, your body will be light and healthy, and you will have an appetite for food. Your food will be digested, and your strength and radiance will increase.

original: / de la bad kan tshabs che ste /
analyzed: / de la bad kan tshabs che ste /
translated: If phlegm is excessive,

original: rang gi gnas las lud nas bad kan phyi rol tu 'byung zhing de yang gnyid nad dang / cham pa dang yi ga 'chus pa dang / lud pa dang / gsud pa dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing zas zos ma thag ldang ba'i rims nad ma zhu ba dang bcas pa de la ni skyug sman gtang bar 'os te slon bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas las lud nas bad kan phyi rol tu 'byung zhing de yang gnyid nad dang / cham pa dang yi ga 'chus pa dang / lud pa dang / gsud pa dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing zas zos ma thag ldang ba'i rims nad ma zhu ba dang bcas pa de la ni skyug sman gtang bar 'os te slon bya'o //
translated: When phlegm is displaced from its site and comes out externally, along with sleep, cold, anorexia, cough, vomiting, and indigestion immediately after eating, emesis is indicated.üîΩIn other fevers, emesis may cause dyspnea, diarrhea, confusion, heart disease, and chronic fever.

original: rims nad gzhan la skyug sman btang na ni dbugs mi bde ba dang / 'khru ba dang / rmongs pa dang / snying nad dang / rims mi zad pa rnams kyis 'debs so //
analyzed: rims nad gzhan la skyug sman btang na ni dbugs mi bde ba dang / 'khru ba dang / rmongs pa dang / snying nad dang / rims mi zad pa rnams kyis 'debs so //
translated: One should administer emetics with any of the following:üîΩposion ivy,

original: po son cha dang / dug mo yungs dang / shing mngar gang yang rung ba /
analyzed: po son cha dang / dug mo yungs dang / shing mngar gang yang rung ba /
translated: white mustard, or sweet flag,

original: pi pi ling dang lhan cig gam /
analyzed: pi pi ling dang lhan cig gam /
translated: either together with long pepper,

original: yang na chu dron po dang sbrang rtsi lan tshva dang bcas pa blud la skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: yang na chu dron po dang sbrang rtsi lan tshva dang bcas pa blud la skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: or with warm water, honey, and salt, and induce vomiting.

original: yang na pa to la dang / nim pa dang / ga gon dang / sba dang / 'di rnams kyi lo ma gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba dang / 'bras yos kyi skyo ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / chang dang de dag gang yang rung ba'i nang du po son cha'i phye mas btab pa blud do //
analyzed: yang na pa to la dang / nim pa dang / ga gon dang / sba dang / 'di rnams kyi lo ma gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba dang / 'bras yos kyi skyo ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / chang dang de dag gang yang rung ba'i nang du po son cha'i phye mas btab pa blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one should give a drink of the decoction of any of the leaves of patola, nimba, ghonta, or bamboo, mixed with rice water, molasses water, wine, or any of these, and with poshakas.

original: yang na nyams stobs dang / dus kyi bye brag shes pa'i sman pas cho ga grub pa'i nang du bshad pa'i skyug sman gtang bar bya'o //üîΩgong ma'i skyug sman byas kyang rung /
analyzed: yang na nyams stobs dang / dus kyi bye brag shes pa'i sman pas cho ga grub pa'i nang du bshad pa'i skyug sman gtang bar bya'o // gong ma'i skyug sman byas kyang rung /
translated: Or, a physician who knows the strength of the patient and the specific time should give emetics according to the ritual described in the Siddhasara.

original: ma byas kyang rung /
analyzed: ma byas kyang rung /
translated: Whether one has performed the above emetic or not,

original: rims nad can gyi skyes bu la ni nyis pa rnams rang gi gnas las nyams shing drod skyed pas nad smin pa dang zhi bar bya ba'i phyir khyad par du smyung ba byas na phan no //
analyzed: rims nad can gyi skyes bu la ni nyis pa rnams rang gi gnas las nyams shing drod skyed pas nad smin pa dang zhi bar bya ba'i phyir khyad par du smyung ba byas na phan no //
translated: For a person with fever, fasting is especially beneficial for ripening and pacifying the disease, as the humors are weakened from their own locations and generate heat.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi me mdag la thal bas g-yogs na /
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi me mdag la thal bas g-yogs na /
translated: For example, if one covers external embers with ashes,

original: kha zas la sogs pa 'tshor mi nus pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pa 'tshor mi nus pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: It is like being unable to digest food and so on.

original: khong pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pas g-yogs na kha zas 'ju mi nus te /
analyzed: khong pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pas g-yogs na kha zas 'ju mi nus te /
translated: If it is covered by faults such as stomach wind, one is unable to digest food.

original: de bas na slon byas pa'i 'og tu smin par gyur pa'i phyir smyung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na slon byas pa'i 'og tu smin par gyur pa'i phyir smyung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Therefore, fasting and so on should be done in order to ripen the stomach.

original: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rims skom dad che ba la ni /
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rims skom dad che ba la ni /
translated: In the case of a fever caused by phlegm and wind, with a strong desire to drink,

original: chu dron po nyung du nyung du byin na bad kan skam po sla bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu dron po nyung du nyung du byin na bad kan skam po sla bar bya'o //
translated: if a little warm water is given, the dry phlegm will be easily removed.

original: skom dang myur du @153a * //
analyzed: skom dang myur du @153a * //
translated: If one drinks quickly,üîΩthe digestive heat and the flow of the channels will be smooth and pure, and bile, wind, sweat, feces, urine, and so on will also be well produced.

original: 'jil bar byed na me drod dang rtsa'i rgyun srang yang 'jam zhing dag pa dang / mkhris pa dang / rlung dang / rngul dang / phyi sa dang / gcin dang / 'di rnams kyang legs par 'byung bar byed la gnyid dang / rmongs bag dang /
analyzed: 'jil bar byed na me drod dang rtsa'i rgyun srang yang 'jam zhing dag pa dang / mkhris pa dang / rlung dang / rngul dang / phyi sa dang / gcin dang / 'di rnams kyang legs par 'byung bar byed la gnyid dang / rmongs bag dang /
translated: It also takes away sleepiness, dullness,

original: yi ga 'chus pa rnams 'phrog cing srog 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: yi ga 'chus pa rnams 'phrog cing srog 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and loss of appetite, and sustains life.

original: gal te chu grang 'thungs na phan yon gong ma log par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chu grang 'thungs na phan yon gong ma log par 'gyur te /
translated: If one drinks cold water, the benefits are the opposite of the above.

original: nad kyi tshogs skyed par byed do //
analyzed: nad kyi tshogs skyed par byed do //
translated: It produces a host of diseases.

original: chu dron po 'thungs na phan yon gong ma ltar yod na yang gcig tu mkhris pa can la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chu dron po 'thungs na phan yon gong ma ltar yod na yang gcig tu mkhris pa can la ni ma yin te /
translated: If one drinks warm water, there are the above benefits, but not for those who are exclusively of a bile type.

original: de yang mkhris pa shas che ba dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po'i nad dang / lus tsha ba dang / rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / 'khru ba dang / dug dang chang las gyur pa'i rims dang / sos ka tsha ba'i dus dang /
analyzed: de yang mkhris pa shas che ba dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po'i nad dang / lus tsha ba dang / rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / 'khru ba dang / dug dang chang las gyur pa'i rims dang / sos ka tsha ba'i dus dang /
translated: Also, for those with an excess of bile, for eye and other sense diseases, for a hot body, for sluggishness, for diarrhea, for fevers from poison and alcohol, for the hot season of spring,

original: lus zad cing skem pa dang / mkhris pa dang khrag la ni chu dron po mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus zad cing skem pa dang / mkhris pa dang khrag la ni chu dron po mi sbyar ro //
translated: for emaciation and drying of the body, for bile and blood, warm water is not applied.

original: gla sgang dang / tsandan dang / bca' sga dang ; par pa ta dang / pu shel tsi dang / ba le ka dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rims nad kyi skom dad can la sbyar na kha zas 'ju bar byed cing skom dad 'joms so //
analyzed: gla sgang dang / tsandan dang / bca' sga dang ; par pa ta dang / pu shel tsi dang / ba le ka dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba bskol ba'i khu ba mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rims nad kyi skom dad can la sbyar na kha zas 'ju bar byed cing skom dad 'joms so //
translated: The decoctions of ginger, sandalwood, cardamom, parpata, pushkaramula, and valerian, any of which may be used, relieve thirst in patients with fever due to tripa disorders when added to the decoction. They help digestion and relieve thirst.

original: mkhris pa med na drod med /
analyzed: mkhris pa med na drod med /
translated: If there is no tripa, there is no heat.

original: drod med na rims med de /
analyzed: drod med na rims med de /
translated: If there is no heat, there is no fever.

original: de bas na mkhris pa dang mi mthun pa'i bza' ba dang / spyod lam thams cad shas cher spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mkhris pa dang mi mthun pa'i bza' ba dang / spyod lam thams cad shas cher spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all foods and activities that are incompatible with tripa should be avoided.

original: mdor na rims nad thams cad la smyung ba ma gtogs par lus kyi khrus dang / bsku ba dang byug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad spang ngo //
analyzed: mdor na rims nad thams cad la smyung ba ma gtogs par lus kyi khrus dang / bsku ba dang byug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad spang ngo //
translated: In brief, in all types of fever, except for fasting, all physical activities such as bathing, massage, and anointing should be avoided.

original: rims ma smin pa mi zad par na ba la ni ;
analyzed: rims ma smin pa mi zad par na ba la ni ;
translated: In immature and chronic fever,

original: sman gyi khu ba dang 'dag gu la sogs pa mi blud de /
analyzed: sman gyi khu ba dang 'dag gu la sogs pa mi blud de /
translated: medicinal decoctions, purgation, and so on should not be administered.

original: ci ltar ma zhu ba la zug gzer 'joms pa'i sman mi blud pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ci ltar ma zhu ba la zug gzer 'joms pa'i sman mi blud pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like not giving medicine to someone who cannot digest it.

original: gal te blud par gyur na ni phyir zhing nad skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te blud par gyur na ni phyir zhing nad skyed par byed de /
translated: If you do give it, it will cause further illness.

original: sbrul la 'o ma blud pa bzhin no //üîΩbad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rims snyom pa dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rje ngar dang rus tshigs su zug cing na ba la ni dugs bya bar rab tu bsngags te /
analyzed: sbrul la 'o ma blud pa bzhin no // bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rims snyom pa dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rje ngar dang rus tshigs su zug cing na ba la ni dugs bya bar rab tu bsngags te /
translated: It is like giving milk to someone with snake venom.üîΩFor a fever of phlegm and wind, with chills, a runny nose, difficulty breathing, and pain in the calves and joints, a hot fomentation is highly recommended.

original: rngul dang / bshang gci dang / 'phyen bde bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rngul dang / bshang gci dang / 'phyen bde bar 'byung ste /
translated: It promotes the easy flow of sweat, feces, urine, and burped-up mucus.

original: me'i drod kyang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: me'i drod kyang skyed par byed do //
translated: It also generates the heat of fire.

original: snum chos kyi cho gar bshad pa'i nang du chu dron las @153b byas pa'i dugs thams cad 'dir spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: snum chos kyi cho gar bshad pa'i nang du chu dron las @153b byas pa'i dugs thams cad 'dir spyad par bya'o //
translated: All hot fomentations made with warm water, as explained in the chapter on oil therapy, should be used here.

original: rims gsar pa la ni thog mar smyung ba dang / dugs 'ba' zhig bya'o //
analyzed: rims gsar pa la ni thog mar smyung ba dang / dugs 'ba' zhig bya'o //
translated: For a new fever, initially only fasting and fomentation should be done.

original: de nas zhag drug gi bar du smin par bya ba'i cho ga la sogs pa thams cad spang ngo //
analyzed: de nas zhag drug gi bar du smin par bya ba'i cho ga la sogs pa thams cad spang ngo //
translated: Then, for six days, all procedures for ripening, and so on, should be avoided.

original: zhag bdun pa nas ni ma smin pa smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa nas ni ma smin pa smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: From the seventh day, to ripen the unripened,

original: nas thug dang tig ta'i khu ba blud de /
analyzed: nas thug dang tig ta'i khu ba blud de /
translated: give barley gruel and Tikta soup.

original: gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du gso'o //üîΩrlung nyi tshe'i rims dang / lus zad pa'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du gso'o // rlung nyi tshe'i rims dang / lus zad pa'am /
translated: Nourish according to the condition.üîΩDo not fast for intermittent fevers, wasting diseases,

original: glo bur las gyur pa'i rims dang / rims rnying pa rnams la smyung ba mi bya ste /
analyzed: glo bur las gyur pa'i rims dang / rims rnying pa rnams la smyung ba mi bya ste /
translated: sudden fevers, or chronic fevers.

original: de la ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i cho ga thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i cho ga thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: In those, apply all the rituals to increase strength.

original: de la thog mar rims smin pa dang / ma smin pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la thog mar rims smin pa dang / ma smin pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ste /
translated: First, know the nature of ripened and unripened fevers.

original: de yang nyams brta ba dang spang bar bya ba'i le'u la bltas nas smyung ba byas la legs par 'gyur na lus rjud par snang ste de la thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa nad gzhi so so dang mthun pa'i sman sbyar la rim gyis gtang ngo
analyzed: de yang nyams brta ba dang spang bar bya ba'i le'u la bltas nas smyung ba byas la legs par 'gyur na lus rjud par snang ste de la thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa nad gzhi so so dang mthun pa'i sman sbyar la rim gyis gtang ngo
translated: Also, having looked at the chapter on nourishing and abandoning, if fasting is good but the body appears emaciated, then give only broth and so on, applying medicine suitable for each condition, and gradually give.

original: // de nas thug pa'i khu ba blud pa ni sman pa mkhas pas ji srid du rims rtse zhil nas sam /
analyzed: // de nas thug pa'i khu ba blud pa ni sman pa mkhas pas ji srid du rims rtse zhil nas sam /
translated: Then, the physician should give the patient a drink of the decoction.üîΩ

original: zhag drug lon pa'i 'og tu blud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag drug lon pa'i 'og tu blud par bya'o //
translated: Then, the soup should be given. The wise physician should give it as long as the fever has subsided or after six days have passed.

original: thug pa'i rim pa de ltar byas na /
analyzed: thug pa'i rim pa de ltar byas na /
translated: If the soup is given in this way,

original: pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed do //
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod skyed par byed do //
translated: it generates digestive heat.

original: ji ltar bud shing la me bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing la me bzhin no //
translated: Just like fire in kindling.

original: thug pa'i khu ba dro ba'i phyir rngul 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: thug pa'i khu ba dro ba'i phyir rngul 'byin par byed do //
translated: Because the soup is warm, it causes sweating.

original: sman dang sbyar ba spang ba'i phyir dang me drod skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sman dang sbyar ba spang ba'i phyir dang me drod skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from medicinal preparations and generates digestive heat,

original: khu ba yin pa'i phyir skom pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: khu ba yin pa'i phyir skom pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: because it is a liquid, it alleviates thirst.

original: kha zas yin pa'i phyir nyams stobs skyed par byed do //
analyzed: kha zas yin pa'i phyir nyams stobs skyed par byed do //
translated: Because it is food, it increases strength.

original: rtsar myur du 'gro ba'i phyir yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: rtsar myur du 'gro ba'i phyir yang ba nyid do //
translated: Because it quickly moves through the channels, it is light.

original: rims la phan par byed pa'i phyir rims 'joms so //
analyzed: rims la phan par byed pa'i phyir rims 'joms so //
translated: Because it benefits fever, it conquers fever.

original: de bas na thog mar thug pas rims gso bar bya'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: khyad par du 'jam rtsi mas gtong na phan no //

original: 'byung po'i gdon las gyur pa'i rims la ni sngags dang gtor ma la sogs pa'i cho ga byas na phan no //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon las gyur pa'i rims la ni sngags dang gtor ma la sogs pa'i cho ga byas na phan no //
translated: For fevers that arise from bh≈´ta spirits, it is beneficial to perform the rites of mantra, torma, and so on.

original: sman bdugs pa'i dris phog pa las rims su gyur pa la ni mkhris pa zhi bar byed pa'i sman rnams sbyin na phan no //
analyzed: sman bdugs pa'i dris phog pa las rims su gyur pa la ni mkhris pa zhi bar byed pa'i sman rnams sbyin na phan no //
translated: For fevers that arise from being struck by the smell of burning medicine, it is beneficial to give medicines that pacify bile.

original: dug gis phog pa las rims su gyur pa la ni dug gso ba'i dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: dug gis phog pa las rims su gyur pa la ni dug gso ba'i dpyad bya'o //
translated: For fevers that arise from being struck by poison, perform the treatment for poison.

original: khros pa las gyur pa'i rims la ni gang la dga' ba'i nor sbyin pa dang / snying dga' ba'i gtam bya'o //üîΩdes ma zhi na phan pa'i zas dang sman bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: khros pa las gyur pa'i rims la ni gang la dga' ba'i nor sbyin pa dang / snying dga' ba'i gtam bya'o // des ma zhi na phan pa'i zas dang sman bsten par bya'o //
translated: For fevers that arise from anger, give the wealth that is desired and speak words that delight the heart.üîΩIf that does not pacify it, rely on beneficial food and medicine.

original: des kyang ma zhi na mi phan pa'i zas dang sman gyis gso'o //
analyzed: des kyang ma zhi na mi phan pa'i zas dang sman gyis gso'o //
translated: If that does not pacify it, treat with food and medicine that is not beneficial.

original: de dag gis ma phan na bkru sman gtong na phan no //üîΩkhro ba las rims byung ba la ni 'dod pa bsten pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ma phan na bkru sman gtong na phan no // khro ba las rims byung ba la ni 'dod pa bsten pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these do not help, administering purgatives will be beneficial.üîΩFor those with a fever born from anger, it will be pacified by relying on desire.

original: 'dod pa la chags pa las rims su gyur pa la khro ba bskyed pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //üîΩmya ngan dad 'jigs pa las rims su gyur pa la ni khro ba dang snying du sdug pa dang gnyis ka bsten pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la chags pa las rims su gyur pa la khro ba bskyed pas zhi bar 'gyur ro // mya ngan dad 'jigs pa las rims su gyur pa la ni khro ba dang snying du sdug pa dang gnyis ka bsten pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those with a fever born from attachment to desire, it will be pacified by generating anger.üîΩFor those with a fever born from grief and fear, it will be pacified by relying on both anger and affection.

original: dmod pa dang drag shul gyi las las rims su gyur pa la ni srid srung gi @163b rig byed kyi cho ga'am /
analyzed: dmod pa dang drag shul gyi las las rims su gyur pa la ni srid srung gi @163b rig byed kyi cho ga'am /
translated: For those with a fever born from cursing and violent actions, it will be pacified by performing the rituals of the Atharva Veda

original: lha la sogs pa la mchod pa byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa la mchod pa byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or by making offerings to the gods and so forth.

original: glo bur du byung ba'i rims de rnams thog mar ni gcig pu byung ba yin na phyis ni nad gzhi 'dres nas byung ba yin te /
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba'i rims de rnams thog mar ni gcig pu byung ba yin na phyis ni nad gzhi 'dres nas byung ba yin te /
translated: If these sudden fevers first occur alone and later arise mixed with other illnesses,

original: de bas na glo bur du byung ba'i rims la ni sman dang dpyad nad gzhi dang ji ltar mthun par gso'o //
analyzed: de bas na glo bur du byung ba'i rims la ni sman dang dpyad nad gzhi dang ji ltar mthun par gso'o //
translated: then for sudden fevers, treat with medicine and therapy in accordance with the illness.

original: rims de rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi mi ldan gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: rims de rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi mi ldan gyi bar du ni /
translated: It is not a disease of wind and so forth.üîΩ

original: gting zug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gting zug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until the fever is associated with a humoral disorder of wind, bile, or phlegm, it remains in the depth.üîΩWhen the fever is about to break, if the patient thinks about it, the fever will return.

original: rims ldang ba'i dus su sems pa las rims su gyur pa la ni yul yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs mngon du byas na dran pa zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims ldang ba'i dus su sems pa las rims su gyur pa la ni yul yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs mngon du byas na dran pa zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he is shown various pleasant things, his memory of the fever will be calmed.

original: sems can thams cad la yid dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yid dga' bar bya ste /
translated: He should be made to feel joy toward all beings.

original: snying rjes sems brlan par gyur na rims 'joms so //üîΩskyes bu rims dang bral zhing nyams stobs ma skyes pa la ni lus kyi rtsol ba dang / 'khrig pa dang / de bzhin du kha zas lci ba dang / ma goms pa dang tsha ba bskyed pa dang / gzhan rims skyed pa'i rgyu thams cad spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying rjes sems brlan par gyur na rims 'joms so // skyes bu rims dang bral zhing nyams stobs ma skyes pa la ni lus kyi rtsol ba dang / 'khrig pa dang / de bzhin du kha zas lci ba dang / ma goms pa dang tsha ba bskyed pa dang / gzhan rims skyed pa'i rgyu thams cad spang bar bya'o //
translated: If his mind is moistened with compassion, the fever will be overcome.üîΩWhen a person is free from fever but has not yet regained his strength, he should avoid all physical exertion, sexual intercourse, and heavy, indigestible, or hot foods, as well as all other causes of fever.

original: rims las byang ba yin na yang kha zas thams cad 'chol bar mang du mi bza' ste //
analyzed: rims las byang ba yin na yang kha zas thams cad 'chol bar mang du mi bza' ste //
translated: Even when he has recovered from the fever, he should not eat too much of any food, especially not very hot or very cold food.

original: nyam chung bas kha zas 'chol bar zos na nad byang ba yin na yang phyir nad ldog par byed do //üîΩde bas na bag ma byas pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten pa las ni srog 'phral la 'phrog par byed pa yin pas khyad par du nad kyi gnas skabs la brtags te /
analyzed: nyam chung bas kha zas 'chol bar zos na nad byang ba yin na yang phyir nad ldog par byed do // de bas na bag ma byas pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten pa las ni srog 'phral la 'phrog par byed pa yin pas khyad par du nad kyi gnas skabs la brtags te /
translated: If one eats unwholesome food due to weakness, even if the disease is cured, it will return.

original: smyung ba dang / dugs dang / nas kyi thug pa dang / tig ta'i khu ba dang ; smin par byed pa'i sman dang / 'o ma dang mar la sogs pa gso ba thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: smyung ba dang / dugs dang / nas kyi thug pa dang / tig ta'i khu ba dang ; smin par byed pa'i sman dang / 'o ma dang mar la sogs pa gso ba thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since improper food and conduct can suddenly take away one's life, especially during illness, one should examine the condition and apply all treatments such as fasting, fomentation, barley soup, Tikta decoction, ripening medicine, milk, ghee, etc.

original: lha khyab 'jug gis gtong ba'i rims shin tu drag po la ni sman dang / nor bu dang / sngags rnams mgo la gdags so //
analyzed: lha khyab 'jug gis gtong ba'i rims shin tu drag po la ni sman dang / nor bu dang / sngags rnams mgo la gdags so //
translated: For severe contagious fevers released by the god Vishnu, medicines, gems, and mantras should be applied to the head.

original: gzhan yang pha ma la sogs pa dam pa rnams dang / bla ma dang / bram ze dang / lha rnams la mchod pa dang / yid dga' bar byed pa'i 'dod pa'i yul rnams bsten par byas pas kyang rims rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgso ba'i gnas las rims nad gso ba'i le'u ste dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzhan yang pha ma la sogs pa dam pa rnams dang / bla ma dang / bram ze dang / lha rnams la mchod pa dang / yid dga' bar byed pa'i 'dod pa'i yul rnams bsten par byas pas kyang rims rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro // gso ba'i gnas las rims nad gso ba'i le'u ste dang po rdzogs so /
translated: Furthermore, infectious fevers are pacified by making offerings to parents and other holy beings, to gurus, Brahmins, and gods, and by enjoying desirable objects that delight the mind.üîΩThis concludes the first chapter, on the treatment of infectious fevers, from The Quintessence Tantra: The Four Glorious Tantras of Medical Science.

original: // / @164a * //  de nas khrag mkhris gso ba'i le'u gnyis pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / @164a * //  de nas khrag mkhris gso ba'i le'u gnyis pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Chapter Two: The Treatment of Blood and Pitta Disorders

original: skyes bu stobs dang ldan zhing khrag stod du shugs mi drag par 'byung ba de yang gsar du dgun nam grang ba'i dus su bla brnan med par 'byung na /
analyzed: skyes bu stobs dang ldan zhing khrag stod du shugs mi drag par 'byung ba de yang gsar du dgun nam grang ba'i dus su bla brnan med par 'byung na /
translated: A person who is strong and whose blood is not excessively forceful may develop a new case of blood and pitta disorders in winter or during the cold season, without any underlying condition.

original: mdo'i gnas nad med par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i le'u las khrag mkhris shas che bar 'gyur ba'i gso ba 'dir sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo'i gnas nad med par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i le'u las khrag mkhris shas che bar 'gyur ba'i gso ba 'dir sbyar ro //
translated: The treatment for blood and pitta disorders, which is taught in the chapter on the healthy state in the Explanatory Tantra, is applied here.

original: khrag mkhris thur du byung ba dang / nad gzhi gnyis 'dres pa las 'byung ba dang / ldang dub byed pa dang / stod du byung ba'i khrag kha dang / sna dang / mig dang / rna ba'i bu gar 'pho zhing 'byung ba dang / smad du byung ba'i khrag pho mtshan dang /üîΩrkub nas 'byung ba dang / yang na khrag stod smad du phyin ci log tu 'byung ba rnams la ni rim pas khad kyis brdal la gso'o //
analyzed: khrag mkhris thur du byung ba dang / nad gzhi gnyis 'dres pa las 'byung ba dang / ldang dub byed pa dang / stod du byung ba'i khrag kha dang / sna dang / mig dang / rna ba'i bu gar 'pho zhing 'byung ba dang / smad du byung ba'i khrag pho mtshan dang / rkub nas 'byung ba dang / yang na khrag stod smad du phyin ci log tu 'byung ba rnams la ni rim pas khad kyis brdal la gso'o //
translated: Blood and bile flowing downward, arising from a combination of the two disorders, causing exhaustion, blood arising from the upper part of the body through the mouth, nose, eyes, and ears, and blood arising from the lower part of the body through the penis and anus, or blood arising in the upper and lower parts in the reverse direction, should be gradually spread out and treated.

original: stod smad gnyis ka las khrag cher 'byung zhing me'i drod chung ba dang / nad gzhi gsum las gyur pa dang / stod smad gang yang rung ba las tshabs cher 'byung ba rnams ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: stod smad gnyis ka las khrag cher 'byung zhing me'i drod chung ba dang / nad gzhi gsum las gyur pa dang / stod smad gang yang rung ba las tshabs cher 'byung ba rnams ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those with excessive blood flow from both the upper and lower parts, with little digestive heat, arising from a combination of the three disorders, or with severe symptoms in either the upper or lower parts, should be abandoned.

original: de la nad gzhi dang / nyi ma ring thung nur ba'i dus dang / khrag mkhris de nad gzhi gang dang 'brel nas stobs che chung du song ba dang / yul dang dus la sogs pa brtags nas khrag gong 'og gang nas byung ba la sogs pa bye brag shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de la nad gzhi dang / nyi ma ring thung nur ba'i dus dang / khrag mkhris de nad gzhi gang dang 'brel nas stobs che chung du song ba dang / yul dang dus la sogs pa brtags nas khrag gong 'og gang nas byung ba la sogs pa bye brag shes par byas nas /
translated: Having examined the disease, the length of the day, the time of the year, and the strength of the blood and bile in relation to the disease, and having understood the specific causes of the blood, whether it is from above or below, and so forth,

original: de'i 'og tu smyung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smyung ba'am /
translated: then fasting,

original: lus 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'am /
analyzed: lus 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'am /
translated: increasing and nourishing the body,

original: lus sbyang ba'am /
analyzed: lus sbyang ba'am /
translated: purifying the body,

original: sman gyis zhi bar bya ba rnams gang rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyis zhi bar bya ba rnams gang rigs par bya'o //
translated: or pacifying with medicine should be done as appropriate.

original: kha zas dro ba dang rno ba la sogs pas mkhris pa'i nad skyes pa de yang /
analyzed: kha zas dro ba dang rno ba la sogs pas mkhris pa'i nad skyes pa de yang /
translated: That blood disease which arises from hot and sharp food and so forth,

original: nad gzhi mang po dang 'dres te nyams stobs dang ldan la khrag stod du byung ba la ni bkru sman btang la /
analyzed: nad gzhi mang po dang 'dres te nyams stobs dang ldan la khrag stod du byung ba la ni bkru sman btang la /
translated: if it is mixed with many other diseases and has strength, and if the blood is in the upper part of the body, then emetic medicine should be given.

original: smad du byung ba la ni skyug sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: smad du byung ba la ni skyug sman gtang ngo //
translated: If it is in the lower part of the body, then purgative medicine should be given.

original: lus 'phel zhing nyams stobs dang ldan na ni smyung ba bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'phel zhing nyams stobs dang ldan na ni smyung ba bya'o //
translated: If the body is increasing and has strength, then fasting should be done.

original: gal te lus smyung ba byas pa dang / ring pa yin na ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lus smyung ba byas pa dang / ring pa yin na ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: If the bleeding is from the upper part of the body and the patient is weak, perform the strength-generating ritual.

original: khrag stod du byung ba la ni kha ba dang / bska ba'i sman gyi khu bas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: khrag stod du byung ba la ni kha ba dang / bska ba'i sman gyi khu bas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: For bleeding from the upper part of the body, pacify with a decoction of astringent and bitter medicines.

original: smyung ba byas pa la ni bca' sga ma gtogs pa'i yan lag drug pa'i sman bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: smyung ba byas pa la ni bca' sga ma gtogs pa'i yan lag drug pa'i sman bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: For bleeding from the lower part of the body, give a decoction of the six-ingredient medicine, excluding asafoetida, to one who has fasted.

original: khrag thur du byung ba la ni mngar ba'i khu bcud kyis zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: khrag thur du byung ba la ni mngar ba'i khu bcud kyis zhi bar bya'o //
translated: For bleeding from the lower part of the body, pacify with a sweet decoction.

original: @164b khrag stod du byung ba la ni thog mar skyo ma blud do //
analyzed: @164b khrag stod du byung ba la ni thog mar skyo ma blud do //
translated: For bleeding from the upper part of the body, first give a decoction.

original: smad du byung ba la ni sman thug blud do //
analyzed: smad du byung ba la ni sman thug blud do //
translated: For bleeding from the lower part of the body, give a medicinal enema.

original: khrag mkhris can nyams stobs yod cing sha ma zad pa la zas za nus pa de ni skyon gyis khrag byung du zin kyang dang bor khrag bcad du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khrag mkhris can nyams stobs yod cing sha ma zad pa la zas za nus pa de ni skyon gyis khrag byung du zin kyang dang bor khrag bcad du mi rung ngo //
translated: If the blood is from a person with a strong constitution, who has not lost much flesh, and who is able to eat, then even if the bleeding is due to a fault, it is not suitable to stop the bleeding at first.

original: bcad sngas na nad mang du skyed do //
analyzed: bcad sngas na nad mang du skyed do //
translated: If it is stopped too soon, it will cause many illnesses.

original: gzhan du na nyams zad cing zas za mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan du na nyams zad cing zas za mi nus te /
translated: Otherwise, if the person is weak and unable to eat,

original: nyes pa dag cing khrag mang du 'byung ba la ni khrag ma bcad na mes tshig pa bzhin du myur du 'chi bar byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa dag cing khrag mang du 'byung ba la ni khrag ma bcad na mes tshig pa bzhin du myur du 'chi bar byed do //
translated: If the fault is purified but blood is excessive, if blood is not stopped, it will quickly kill like a fire.

original: dur byid dang / sha ma dur byid gnyis bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du yang de nyid btags pa'i phye ma dang / sha kha ra'i phye ma dang sbyar nas lag pa'i mthil du bzhag ste bldag go //
analyzed: dur byid dang / sha ma dur byid gnyis bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du yang de nyid btags pa'i phye ma dang / sha kha ra'i phye ma dang sbyar nas lag pa'i mthil du bzhag ste bldag go //
translated: Boil the two, durva and durva fruit, and put the powder of the same and the powder of sugar in the liquid. Put it on the palm of the hand and lick it.

original: dur byid dang / sha ma dur byid dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / pi pi ling dang / sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i ri lu byas te /
analyzed: dur byid dang / sha ma dur byid dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / pi pi ling dang / sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i ri lu byas te /
translated: Make a pill of durva, durva fruit, the three fruits, pippali, and sugar.

original: de las ran par zos na /
analyzed: de las ran par zos na /
translated: If one eats the proper amount from that,

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i khrag stod du lud pa dang / skrang pa dang ; rims rnams 'joms so //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i khrag stod du lud pa dang / skrang pa dang ; rims rnams 'joms so //
translated: it will destroy blood that has risen to the upper part of the body due to a disorder, swelling, and fevers.

original: yang na dur byid dang / sha kha ra cha snyoms te /
analyzed: yang na dur byid dang / sha kha ra cha snyoms te /
translated: Or, make a pill of equal parts durva and sugar,

original: kha ra'i bzhi cha'i pi pi ling dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang / ri lu byas te zos na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kha ra'i bzhi cha'i pi pi ling dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang / ri lu byas te zos na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: one quarter pippali, and make a pill with honey. If one eats it, the benefits are the same as above.

original: yang na khrag thur du 'byung ba la ni skyug sman btang ste /
analyzed: yang na khrag thur du 'byung ba la ni skyug sman btang ste /
translated: For bleeding from the lower part of the body, administer emetics.

original: chu dang skyo ma sbyar ba'i nang du /
analyzed: chu dang skyo ma sbyar ba'i nang du /
translated: Mix water with gruel,

original: po son cha dang / sbrang rtsi dang / kha ra btab pa'am /
analyzed: po son cha dang / sbrang rtsi dang / kha ra btab pa'am /
translated: and add posha, honey, and sugar.

original: yang na po son cha dang / kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / chu dang sbyar ba btang ba'am /üîΩyang na shing mngar bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du po son cha btab pa'am /
analyzed: yang na po son cha dang / kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / chu dang sbyar ba btang ba'am / yang na shing mngar bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du po son cha btab pa'am /
translated: Alternatively, mix posha, sugar, honey, and water.üîΩAlternatively, add posha to a decoction of sweet wood.

original: yang na bu ram chu po son cha dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na bu ram chu po son cha dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, mix posha with water and molasses.

original: sbyor ba de dag las gang yang rung ba byas na skyugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba de dag las gang yang rung ba byas na skyugs par 'gyur te /
translated: Any of these preparations will induce vomiting.

original: thur du 'byung ba'i khrag mkhris la bsngags so //
analyzed: thur du 'byung ba'i khrag mkhris la bsngags so //
translated: This is recommended for bleeding from the lower part of the body due to blood or pitta.

original: de ltar slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having purified the body with purgation,

original: nyams stobs bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyams stobs bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to preserve the strength of the body,

original: rang rang gi gso ba skyo ma dang / thug pa la sogs pa rim bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi gso ba skyo ma dang / thug pa la sogs pa rim bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: one should gradually apply one‚Äôs own nourishing gruel, soup, and so forth.

original: de la skyo ma ni rims nad gso ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i rgun 'brum mam /
analyzed: de la skyo ma ni rims nad gso ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i rgun 'brum mam /
translated: For that, the sour drink is from the treatment of fever, or it is a sour drink of grapes,

original: shing tog ma du ka la sogs pa'i skyo ma'am /
analyzed: shing tog ma du ka la sogs pa'i skyo ma'am /
translated: mangoes, and so forth,

original: yang na mkhris pa 'joms pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs rgun 'brum dang / skyu ru ral sogs pa'i skyo ma blud do //
analyzed: yang na mkhris pa 'joms pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs rgun 'brum dang / skyu ru ral sogs pa'i skyo ma blud do //
translated: or it is a sour drink of grapes, tamarind, and so forth, which are the types of fruits that conquer bile.

original: @165a * // yang na 'bra go dang / rgun 'brum dang / ma du ka dang / pa ru sha ka dang / 'di rnams kha ra dang sbyar ba ni snying po lnga'i skyo ma zhes bya ste blud pa'am /
analyzed: @165a * // yang na 'bra go dang / rgun 'brum dang / ma du ka dang / pa ru sha ka dang / 'di rnams kha ra dang sbyar ba ni snying po lnga'i skyo ma zhes bya ste blud pa'am /
translated: Or, sugar cane, grapes, mangoes, and parushaka, when combined with sugar, are called the sour drink of the five essences, which is given.

original: yang na snying po lnga'i sman khu'i nang du mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / 'bras yos kyi phye ma dang 'di rnams chu dang sbyar ba'i skyo ma blud do //
analyzed: yang na snying po lnga'i sman khu'i nang du mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / 'bras yos kyi phye ma dang 'di rnams chu dang sbyar ba'i skyo ma blud do //
translated: Or, a sour drink is given that is a decoction of the five essences, combined with butter, honey, and rice flour.

translated: This will definitely cure tumors, heart disease, swelling, hemorrhoids, dyspnea, and all types of phlegm.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i lud pa rtag tu 'byung ba la ni /
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i lud pa rtag tu 'byung ba la ni /
translated: For the constant production of phlegm,

original: dud pa kha nas brngub pa'i cho ga bya ba dang yang na bkru sman btang na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud pa kha nas brngub pa'i cho ga bya ba dang yang na bkru sman btang na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: perform the ritual of inhaling smoke or administer a purgative. This will pacify it.

original: yang na ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / shing mngar dang / gandha man si zhes bya ba spang spos dang / gla sgang dang / shing aing gu da'i shun phrags dang / 'di rnams dang dud pa brngub pa'i cho ga mdo'i gnas su bstan pa bzhin du ji srid lud pa sos kyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / shing mngar dang / gandha man si zhes bya ba spang spos dang / gla sgang dang / shing aing gu da'i shun phrags dang / 'di rnams dang dud pa brngub pa'i cho ga mdo'i gnas su bstan pa bzhin du ji srid lud pa sos kyi bar du bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should inhale the smoke of the following substances, as taught in the sutras, until the phlegm is cured: red arsenic, realgar, sweet flag, gandhamansi, spkng-po, gla-gang, and the bark of ingu-tree.

original: de'i 'og tu bu ram dang / 'o ma dro 'jam tsam du sbyar ba skom du blud na lud pa rtsa ba nas 'joms so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bu ram dang / 'o ma dro 'jam tsam du sbyar ba skom du blud na lud pa rtsa ba nas 'joms so //
translated: After that, if one drinks a warm mixture of sugar and milk, it will completely destroy the phlegm.

original: rlung dang bad kan las gyur ba'i lud pa ni sman khong pa'i dud pa brngub ba byas na /
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan las gyur ba'i lud pa ni sman khong pa'i dud pa brngub ba byas na /
translated: Phlegm arising from wind and bile is cured by inhaling the smoke of medicinal herbs.

original: rgyun gyi lud pa dang 'phral gyi lud pa 'joms so //
analyzed: rgyun gyi lud pa dang 'phral gyi lud pa 'joms so //
translated: This will destroy both chronic and acute phlegm.

original: bad kan gyi lud pa bar bar du mun pa bzhin du snang na ni mkhris pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: bad kan gyi lud pa bar bar du mun pa bzhin du snang na ni mkhris pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: If phlegm appears from time to time like darkness, it is associated with bile.

original: de la ni mkhris pa dang / bad kan gso ba'i cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni mkhris pa dang / bad kan gso ba'i cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: In that case, one should treat it according to the treatment of bile and phlegm.

original: bad kan dang rlung 'dres pa'i lud pa'i nad la ni dang po bad kan 'ba' zhig gso ba'i dpyad gong du bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung 'dres pa'i lud pa'i nad la ni dang po bad kan 'ba' zhig gso ba'i dpyad gong du bstan pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: For phlegm and wind combined, first apply the above-mentioned treatment for phlegm alone.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'di gsum 'dus pa'i lud pa la ni thog mar mkhris pa gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'di gsum 'dus pa'i lud pa la ni thog mar mkhris pa gso bar bya'o //
translated: For phlegm with a combination of wind, bile, and phlegm, first treat the bile.

original: rlung dang bad kan gyi lud pa skam po 'byung ste /
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan gyi lud pa skam po 'byung ste /
translated: If the phlegm is dry, it is a wind and phlegm combination.

original: rlung shas che ba la ni snum gyi cho ga bya'o //üîΩ@172b de nyid phyi sa sla bar 'byung ste /üîΩbad kan gyi shas che ba la ni rtsub pa'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: rlung shas che ba la ni snum gyi cho ga bya'o // @172b de nyid phyi sa sla bar 'byung ste / bad kan gyi shas che ba la ni rtsub pa'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: If the wind is dominant, perform the oil procedure.üîΩIf the phlegm is dominant, perform the rough procedure.

original: mkhris pa'i shas che na ni kha ba'i bag bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i shas che na ni kha ba'i bag bsten par bya'o //
translated: If the bile is dominant, rely on the bitter.

original: glo 'grams te khrag dang bcas pa'i lud pa 'byung ba la ne de ma thag rgya skyegs dang sbrang rtsi dang 'o ma dang 'di gsum sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: glo 'grams te khrag dang bcas pa'i lud pa 'byung ba la ne de ma thag rgya skyegs dang sbrang rtsi dang 'o ma dang 'di gsum sbyar ba blud do //
translated: If there is a flow of blood with the phlegm, immediately give a drink of a mixture of lac, honey, and milk.

original: de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na 'bras chan 'o ma dang sha kha ra dang bcas pa sbyin no //üîΩlud pa lu ba'i tshe rtsib logs gnyis dang / chu sor zug gzer byed cing mkhris pa'i me drod chung ba la ni rgya skyegs chang dang sbyar ba blud do //üîΩlud pa lu zhing phyis sla bar 'byung ba la ni me'i drod nyams chung na de la ni rgya skyegs dang / gla sgang dang / bong nga dkar po dang / pa ca dang / dug mo yungs kyi shing shun dang 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na 'bras chan 'o ma dang sha kha ra dang bcas pa sbyin no // lud pa lu ba'i tshe rtsib logs gnyis dang / chu sor zug gzer byed cing mkhris pa'i me drod chung ba la ni rgya skyegs chang dang sbyar ba blud do // lud pa lu zhing phyis sla bar 'byung ba la ni me'i drod nyams chung na de la ni rgya skyegs dang / gla sgang dang / bong nga dkar po dang / pa ca dang / dug mo yungs kyi shing shun dang 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: When the patient is able to tolerate this, rice gruel, milk, meat, sugar, and so forth should be given.üîΩWhen there is expectoration of phlegm, if there is pain in the two sides and the urinary bladder, and if there is little digestive heat, administer a decoction of myrobalan and alcohol.üîΩIf there is expectoration of phlegm and easy post-nasal drip, if there is little digestive heat, administer a decoction of myrobalan, ginger, white aconite, patha, and Indian caper bark mixed with water.

original: lud pa lu zhing me drod tshabs cher skyes pa la ni rgya skyegs dang / mar dang ; spra tshil dang / sman 'tsho byed kyi sde tshan dang / smyig rkang dang 'di rnams cha snyoms te 'o ma dang bskol ba blud na phan no //
analyzed: lud pa lu zhing me drod tshabs cher skyes pa la ni rgya skyegs dang / mar dang ; spra tshil dang / sman 'tsho byed kyi sde tshan dang / smyig rkang dang 'di rnams cha snyoms te 'o ma dang bskol ba blud na phan no //
translated: If there is expectoration of phlegm and a greatly increased digestive heat, administer a decoction of myrobalan, ghee, lac, and the Jivaniya group of herbs, and bamboo manna, all in equal parts, boiled with milk. This is beneficial.

original: glo 'grams te khrag ma chod pa la ni /
analyzed: glo 'grams te khrag ma chod pa la ni /
translated: For loong-dominant hemoptysis,

original: aishtr'a  ri ka dang / padma'i rtsa ba'i tshigs dang / padma ge sar dang / tsandan dkar po dang / 'di rnams cham chom brdungs te /
analyzed: aishtr'a  ri ka dang / padma'i rtsa ba'i tshigs dang / padma ge sar dang / tsandan dkar po dang / 'di rnams cham chom brdungs te /
translated: pound ishtaari, lotus stem joints, lotus stamen, and white sandalwood together.

original: 'o ma dang bskol ba bsgrangs pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi btab pa 'thungs na khrag chod par byed do //üîΩyang na nas rjen btags pa'i 'o ma dang bskol ba'i thug pa mar dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: 'o ma dang bskol ba bsgrangs pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi btab pa 'thungs na khrag chod par byed do // yang na nas rjen btags pa'i 'o ma dang bskol ba'i thug pa mar dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Drink the decoction boiled with milk and added honey. This will stop bleeding.üîΩAlternatively, drink porridge boiled with milk and roasted barley flour mixed with butter.

original: yang na kha ra dkar po'i phye ma dang / 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i thug pa blud na /
analyzed: yang na kha ra dkar po'i phye ma dang / 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i thug pa blud na /
translated: Alternatively, give porridge made with white sugar, milk, and honey.

original: glo 'grams pa'i nad dang rims sel to //üîΩzad byed kyi lud pa la ni mngar ba'i sman rgun 'brum dang / shing mngar la sogs pa sbyar ba'i mar byin na phan no //
analyzed: glo 'grams pa'i nad dang rims sel to // zad byed kyi lud pa la ni mngar ba'i sman rgun 'brum dang / shing mngar la sogs pa sbyar ba'i mar byin na phan no //
translated: This cures loong-dominant hemoptysis and contagious disorders.üîΩFor khaekhaek hemoptysis, give butter prepared from sweet medicines such as grapes and sweet shing.

original: yang na bu ram chu bskol ba dang bsgrangs pa'i nang du na le sham dang sbrang rtsi btab pa blud pa'am /
analyzed: yang na bu ram chu bskol ba dang bsgrangs pa'i nang du na le sham dang sbrang rtsi btab pa blud pa'am /
translated: Alternatively, give a decoction boiled from jaggery and water added with nalame and honey.

original: yang na skyu ru ra'i phye ma dang 'o ma dang bskol ba mar dang ldan pa blud pa'am /
analyzed: yang na skyu ru ra'i phye ma dang 'o ma dang bskol ba mar dang ldan pa blud pa'am /
translated: Alternatively, one should give a drink of sour plum powder boiled with milk and ghee.

original: yang na bcud kyis len gyi skabs su pi pi ling gi cho ga bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩlud pa lu ba dang / tshigs dang rus par zug cing na ba la ni sbrang rtsi dang / shing mngar dang / @173a * //
analyzed: yang na bcud kyis len gyi skabs su pi pi ling gi cho ga bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // lud pa lu ba dang / tshigs dang rus par zug cing na ba la ni sbrang rtsi dang / shing mngar dang / @173a * //
translated: Or one should prepare it according to the Pippali ritual taught in the Rasayana section.üîΩFor expectorating phlegm and pain in the joints and bones, one should give honey, sweet flag,

original: shing tog ma du ka dang / rgun 'brum dang / tu kashki ra zhes bya ba'i smyig rkang dang / ba la dang / pi pi ling dang 'di rnams mar dang sbyar ba byin na phan no //
analyzed: shing tog ma du ka dang / rgun 'brum dang / tu kashki ra zhes bya ba'i smyig rkang dang / ba la dang / pi pi ling dang 'di rnams mar dang sbyar ba byin na phan no //
translated: mango fruit, grapes, bamboo shoots called tushakara, ghee, and long pepper mixed with ghee. This is beneficial.

original: yang na tri dza tra zhes bya ba dri sna gsum zho re re dang / pi pi ling srang phyed dang / kha ra dkar po dang / shing tog ma du ka dang / khar dzu ra zhes bya ba 'bra go dang 'di rnams zho re re zhib tu btags la sbrang rtsi dang ri lu byas pa ni sug smel gyi ri lu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na tri dza tra zhes bya ba dri sna gsum zho re re dang / pi pi ling srang phyed dang / kha ra dkar po dang / shing tog ma du ka dang / khar dzu ra zhes bya ba 'bra go dang 'di rnams zho re re zhib tu btags la sbrang rtsi dang ri lu byas pa ni sug smel gyi ri lu zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, trijatara means three parts each of trikatu, one part of pippali, one part of white sugar, one part of madhuka fruit, and one part of karjura. Grind these into a fine powder and make it into pills with honey and jaggery. This is called sukshmela pills.

original: de las ran par zos na ro tsa bar byed de /
analyzed: de las ran par zos na ro tsa bar byed de /
translated: If taken in the proper dose, it will digest ama.

original: khrag dang mkhris pa dang / lud pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / skyugs pa dang / brgyal ba dang / skyigs bu dang / rmongs pa dang mgo 'khor ba dang / glo gcong zad byed kyi nad dang /
analyzed: khrag dang mkhris pa dang / lud pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / skyugs pa dang / brgyal ba dang / skyigs bu dang / rmongs pa dang mgo 'khor ba dang / glo gcong zad byed kyi nad dang /
translated: It cures blood, pitta, phlegm, asthma, loss of appetite, vomiting, fainting, hiccups, confusion, dizziness, and chronic cough.

original: glo 'grams pa'i nad dang / skad nyams pa dang / mchin pa na ba dang / skem byed kyi nad dang / dreg dang / lud pa khrag tu 'byung ba dang / snying dang / rtsib logs na ba dang / skom dad che ba dang /
analyzed: glo 'grams pa'i nad dang / skad nyams pa dang / mchin pa na ba dang / skem byed kyi nad dang / dreg dang / lud pa khrag tu 'byung ba dang / snying dang / rtsib logs na ba dang / skom dad che ba dang /
translated: It is also beneficial for diseases of the lungs, loss of voice, liver disorders, consumption, phlegm, blood-stained sputum, heart and rib pain, and excessive thirst.

original: rims sna tshogs la yang phan no //
analyzed: rims sna tshogs la yang phan no //
translated: It is also beneficial for various fevers.

original: lud pa khrag tu 'byung ba la ni ba spru ba me tog dmar po can dang / sha kha ra dang / 'bras thug po che dang / s'a lu dmar po'i phye ma rgun chu dang / 'o ma dang chu bzhin du bskol ba'i nang du mar btab pa blud do //
analyzed: lud pa khrag tu 'byung ba la ni ba spru ba me tog dmar po can dang / sha kha ra dang / 'bras thug po che dang / s'a lu dmar po'i phye ma rgun chu dang / 'o ma dang chu bzhin du bskol ba'i nang du mar btab pa blud do //
translated: For blood-stained sputum, give a drink of red-flowered Indian madder, sugar, black pepper, red rice flour, and ghee cooked in grape juice, milk, and water.

original: yang na shing mngar dang / shing tog ma du ka dang / 'bras thug po che dang / 'o mar sbyar ba'i thug pa blud na phan no //
analyzed: yang na shing mngar dang / shing tog ma du ka dang / 'bras thug po che dang / 'o mar sbyar ba'i thug pa blud na phan no //
translated: Alternatively, give a drink of sweet flag, mango, black pepper, and rice porridge mixed with milk.

original: glo 'grams te kha dang sna la sogs pa las khrag mang po lud pa la ni khrag dang / mkhris pa'i gso ba thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: glo 'grams te kha dang sna la sogs pa las khrag mang po lud pa la ni khrag dang / mkhris pa'i gso ba thams cad bya'o //
translated: For blood-stained sputum from the lungs, mouth, nose, and so on, perform all the treatments for blood and pitta disorders.

original: glo 'grams pa'i lud pa rlung gis lam gzhan du song ste /
analyzed: glo 'grams pa'i lud pa rlung gis lam gzhan du song ste /
translated: If the phlegm of loong-dominant cough is expelled by loong through other channels,

original: lud pa ma thon zhing 'gags pa la ni /
analyzed: lud pa ma thon zhing 'gags pa la ni /
translated: and if the cough is not productive,

original: ra'i tshil ran par bzhus la chang gi nang du rgyam tsha dang ldan par byas te blud na phan no ;üîΩ/ glo 'grams pa dang / nyams stobs chung ba dang glo gcong zad byed dang / gnyid mi 'ong ba dang / me drod rno ches pa la ni 'o ma bskol te /
analyzed: ra'i tshil ran par bzhus la chang gi nang du rgyam tsha dang ldan par byas te blud na phan no ; / glo 'grams pa dang / nyams stobs chung ba dang glo gcong zad byed dang / gnyid mi 'ong ba dang / me drod rno ches pa la ni 'o ma bskol te /
translated: then administer a decoction of Rtswa, Tsha, and La prepared with a suitable amount of fat, and mixed with chang and Gyam tsha.

original: sbris ma ska bar gyur pa'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang sbyar ba'i bza' ba sbyin no //
analyzed: sbris ma ska bar gyur pa'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang sbyar ba'i bza' ba sbyin no //
translated: For loong-dominant cough, weakness, chronic cough, insomnia, and excessive digestive heat, boil milk and add a food preparation of raw meat, sugar, honey, and butter.

original: yang na kha ra @173b dang ; nas dang / gro dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu'am 'o ma sbyar ba'i thug pa sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na kha ra @173b dang ; nas dang / gro dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu'am 'o ma sbyar ba'i thug pa sbyin no //
translated: Alternatively, administer a paste of sugar, barley, wheat, jibka, and copper powder mixed with honey, or a porridge prepared from these ingredients mixed with milk.

original: khrag dang sha zad pa'i nad la ni srog chags sha za'i sha bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang mar khu dang / sbrang rtsi dang pi pi ling sbyar ba zos na sha khrag skye bar byed do //
analyzed: khrag dang sha zad pa'i nad la ni srog chags sha za'i sha bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang mar khu dang / sbrang rtsi dang pi pi ling sbyar ba zos na sha khrag skye bar byed do //
translated: For a disease of exhausted blood and flesh, one should eat a mixture of ghee, honey, and long pepper in a decoction boiled with the flesh of a flesh-eating animal.

original: glo 'grams pa dang / glo gcong zad byed dang / sa bon dang / dbang po rnams nyams pa la ni /üîΩn+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / shing aa shvadtha dang / plag sha dang / shing s'a la dang / gandha pri yang ku dang / shing ta la'i rtse mo dang / shing 'dzam bu'i shun pa dang / shing pi ya li dang /
analyzed: glo 'grams pa dang / glo gcong zad byed dang / sa bon dang / dbang po rnams nyams pa la ni / n+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / shing aa shvadtha dang / plag sha dang / shing s'a la dang / gandha pri yang ku dang / shing ta la'i rtse mo dang / shing 'dzam bu'i shun pa dang / shing pi ya li dang /
translated: For a disease of the lungs, consumption, or a wasting disease, and for the deterioration of the sense faculties,üîΩone should eat a mixture of milk and a decoction boiled with the bark of the following trees: banyan, udumbara, ashvakarna, sala, gandhaparyanku, palm, jamb≈´, piyƒÅla,

original: shug pa dang / shing aa shva karna dang / 'di rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol ba'i khu ba dang / mar dang 'bras chan dang bcas pa zos na phan no //
analyzed: shug pa dang / shing aa shva karna dang / 'di rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol ba'i khu ba dang / mar dang 'bras chan dang bcas pa zos na phan no //
translated: ≈õirƒ´·π£a, and a≈õvakar·πáa. This is beneficial when eaten with ghee and rice.

analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i glo 'grams pa'i nad btsugs pa ltar na ba la ni lus la mar gyis bsku byug bya'o //
translated: For a cough caused by wind and bile that feels as if a needle is being stabbed into the lungs, anoint the body with ghee.

analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i glo 'grams shing btsugs pa snyam byed pa'i nad la ni /
translated: For a cough caused by wind that feels as if a needle is being stabbed into the lungs,

original: rlung 'joms pa'i sman sna tshogs dang / til mar du sbyar bas bsku byug bya'o //
analyzed: rlung 'joms pa'i sman sna tshogs dang / til mar du sbyar bas bsku byug bya'o //
translated: anoint it with various medicines that conquer wind, mixed with sesame oil.

original: snying dang rtsib logs su zug pa'i nad la ni sman 'tsho byed sna bcu bskol ba'i khu ba mar dang yang bskol la /
analyzed: snying dang rtsib logs su zug pa'i nad la ni sman 'tsho byed sna bcu bskol ba'i khu ba mar dang yang bskol la /
translated: For a pain in the heart and sides, boil the ten-ingredient life-upholding medicine and mix it with ghee.

original: mar 'ba' zhig lus pa blud do //
analyzed: mar 'ba' zhig lus pa blud do //
translated: Drink the mixture until only the ghee remains.

original: yang na snying dang rtsib logs su zug pa na rlung dang mkhris pa dang khrag gang las gyur pa legs par brtags te /
analyzed: yang na snying dang rtsib logs su zug pa na rlung dang mkhris pa dang khrag gang las gyur pa legs par brtags te /
translated: Alternatively, when there is pain in the heart and sides, examine whether it is caused by wind, bile, or blood.

original: so so dang mthun pa'i sman gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: so so dang mthun pa'i sman gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Administer the appropriate medicine for each.

original: shing mngar dang / na ga ba la dang / 'di gnyis bskol ba'i khu ba'i bzhi cha lus pa'i nang du sman khu'i phyed kyi mar dang de dang mnyam pa'i 'o ma btab pa dang / pa ya sya dang / pi pi ling smyig rkang dang /
analyzed: shing mngar dang / na ga ba la dang / 'di gnyis bskol ba'i khu ba'i bzhi cha lus pa'i nang du sman khu'i phyed kyi mar dang de dang mnyam pa'i 'o ma btab pa dang / pa ya sya dang / pi pi ling smyig rkang dang /
translated: The decoction of the two, namely, sweet wood-flower and snake-gourd, is boiled down to one-fourth. To this, half the quantity of ghee and an equal quantity of milk are added, as well as payasya, pippali, and bamboo manna.

original: 'di rnams cham chom brdungs te /
analyzed: 'di rnams cham chom brdungs te /
translated: These are all pounded together.

original: lhan cig bskol la mar 'ba' zhig lus pa dang / de las ran par 'thungs na glo 'grams pa'i nad zhi bar byed do //üîΩsman dzi ban ti'i sde tshan bca' sga dang / nye'u shing dang / bi ra zhes bya ba ram nye ba dang / ba spru ba rnam @174a * //
analyzed: lhan cig bskol la mar 'ba' zhig lus pa dang / de las ran par 'thungs na glo 'grams pa'i nad zhi bar byed do // sman dzi ban ti'i sde tshan bca' sga dang / nye'u shing dang / bi ra zhes bya ba ram nye ba dang / ba spru ba rnam @174a * //
translated: When boiled together and only the ghee remains, if one drinks it in the right amount, it will cure the disease of pleurisy.

original: gnyis dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba dang / ri di dang / kha sral phre'u dang / zur pa dang / ta ma la ka dang / shing ga tra ka dang / pa ya sya dang / rtsa ba chung du lnga dang / rgun 'brum dang /

analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rtag tu skyugs pa'i nad la ni mar khu dro 'jam tsam rgyam tsha dang ldan par 'thungs na phan te /

analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad sel to //

translated: The remedy called Bheki-giri is beneficial when administered in the form of a drink mixed with a large quantity of ghee and oil, and with the juice of meat of fowl etc. and sour substances such as pomegranate.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad 'di la ni ;
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad 'di la ni ;
translated: In this type of vomiting caused by vata,

analyzed: seng phrom la sogs pa'i bkru sman snum dang lan tshva dang bcas pa'i dro 'jam tsam btang na zhi bar byed do //

analyzed: de la skyugs pa'i nad mkhris pa las gyur pa la ni rgun 'brum dang bu ram shing la sogs pa rang rang gi khu ba'i nang du /

analyzed: skyugs pa'i nad mkhris pa las gyur pa sel to //
translated: This cures vomiting caused by bile.

analyzed: aa ru ra dang / rgun 'brum dang / rgya shug dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu byin na /

analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad la phan no // de la bad @190a * //
translated: This is beneficial for vomiting due to bile.

original: kan las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad la ni /
analyzed: kan las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad la ni /
translated: For vomiting due to phlegm,

analyzed: nim pa dang / pi pi ling dang / po son cha dang / 'di rnams kyi slon sman chu dron po dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //

analyzed: nyams stobs chung na ni smyung ba nyi tshe bya'o //

analyzed: ka pid ta'i khu ba gang yang rung ba'i nang du btab ste sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu byin na bad kan las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad sel to // yang na ka pid ta dang / tsha ba gsum sbyar ba'am /
translated: or with the juice of Kapitha fruit. Make a paste with honey. This will cure vomiting caused by phlegm.üîΩAlternatively, take Kapitha fruit, the three hot medicines,

analyzed: byi tsher ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba zos na /
translated: or garlic with honey.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad sel to //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i skyugs pa'i nad sel to //

translated: If you suddenly vomit because you see a disgusting place,

analyzed: gzhan yang yang nas yang du skyugs te /
translated: Furthermore, if vomiting occurs repeatedly,

translated: If one uses any of these, one will be cured of the most terrible vomiting.

translated: For the treatment of heart disease, in the case of a heart disease caused by wind, one should drink a warm mixture of curd whey, sour radish, or sour turnip, with sesame oil and black salt. This will cure heart disease,

original: skran dang / lto ba'i nad las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: skran dang / lto ba'i nad las rgyal bar byed do //

analyzed: til mar nyi tshe lus pa 'thungs na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //

translated: Alternatively, grind bilva, rasna, barley, jujube, pine nuts, beans, lentils, and the five roots into a paste and boil them with water and oil in the proper proportions.
